nodes.name: Read CSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Infer the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.title: Column Names for the CSV

fields.title: Column Types for the CSV

fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: Multi LLM Query
nodes.description: The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.

fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: Select Connection

fields.title: Temperature
fields.description: Temperature setting for the model (default: 0).

fields.name: contentCol
fields.title: Content Column
fields.description: Column name for the text content.

fields.name: imageCol
fields.title: Image Column
fields.description: Column name for the base 64 image.

fields.title: Mode Selection
fields.description: Select the model to use (text, image, text+image).

fields.name: task
fields.title: Select Prompt
fields.description: Specify the task to perform: summary, translation, topic extraction, or other.

optionsMap.translation: Translate the following content to default language
optionsMap.topic_extraction: Extract key topics from the following content.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
I am providing a dataset for analysis. The dataset contains relevant information for generating actionable business and operational insights.


Please analyze the dataset and generate a comprehensive business report in HTML format, ensuring it is structured, visually appealing, and actionable. The report should follow these guidelines:


1. Key Insights


Identify and highlight the most critical insights derived from the data.
Explain their significance for business or operational decision-making.
Highlight key performance indicators (KPIs) and their impact on business objectives.
2. Trends, Patterns, and Relationships


Detect and analyze trends, patterns, and relationships within the dataset.
Provide possible explanations for observed trends and discuss their potential impact on future business strategies.
Use comparative analysis to highlight seasonality, correlations, or dependencies within the data.
3. Comparative Analysis and Strategic Recommendations


Compare different categories, scenarios, or segments present in the data.
Assess and recommend the optimal choices, explaining why they outperform other options.
Discuss alternative options and provide reasoning for why they were not chosen as the best.
Consider cost-benefit analysis, efficiency, and long-term sustainability in recommendations.
4. Anomaly Detection and Risk Analysis


Identify anomalies, outliers, or significant deviations in the data.
Categorize them based on severity (e.g., minor, moderate, significant) and discuss potential causes.
Evaluate the impact of these anomalies on business performance and operational efficiency.
5. Actionable Business Recommendations


Provide actionable recommendations to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance decision-making.
Suggest short-term and long-term strategies to leverage insights for business growth.
Outline steps to mitigate identified risks and capitalize on emerging opportunities.
6. Structured HTML Report Format


Present the report in a well-structured HTML format with the following elements:
Use <h1> for the main title and <h2> for sections.
Use <strong> for emphasizing key points.
Incorporate <table> elements for numerical comparisons.
Use bullet points and spacing to improve readability.
Ensure the report is visually appealing and easy to interpret for stakeholders.
7. Scalability and Adaptability


Ensure the report framework is adaptable for different datasets and models.
Provide insights and recommendations based on available criteria and data dimensions.
Maintain a structured approach regardless of the complexity of the dataset.
Generate the report in HTML format, ensuring clarity, business relevance, and usability across various business scenarios

fields.name: thinkingBudget
fields.title: Thinking Budget
fields.description: Configure the Gemini thinking budget by specifying the number of tokens to allocate for thinking. For Flash and Flash Lite models, values can range from 0 to 24,576 or -1 for dynamic thinking. For 2.5 Pro model, values must be between 1 and 24,576; setting 0 is not allowed.

nodes.name: Concat Columns
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame by concatenating the specified columns of the input DataFrame

fields.name: inputCols
fields.title: Columns
fields.description: Columns to be concatenated

fields.description: Column name for the concatenated columns

fields.name: sep
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: Separator to be used when concatenating the columns
